multiple_choice_question.text: The article proposes a smoothed version of the median test statistic. Which of the following formulas represents the **smoothed median test statistic (M)**?
The article investigates the local power of both the median and Wilcoxon's rank sum test. What does **Pitman's Asymptotic Relative Efficiency (A.R.E.)** measure in this context?
choices: The difference in p-values between two tests.
The ratio of sample sizes required for two tests to achieve the same power.
The ratio of values related to the asymptotic local power of two tests.
The difference in computational cost between two tests.

multiple_choice_question.text: One of the challenges with discrete test statistics is the discreteness of their p-values. The article proposes smoothed versions to address this.  According to the article, what is a **consequence of using the smoothed test statistics (M and W2)** compared to their discrete counterparts?
choices: The smoothed tests become completely distribution-free.
The smoothed tests always have lower p-values.
The smoothed tests are no longer distribution-free but are asymptotically distribution-free.
The smoothed tests lose their Pitman efficiency.

multiple_choice_question.text: The smoothed median test statistic incorporates a kernel function (k∗).  Which of the following is **NOT a property of the kernel function (k∗)** used in the smoothed median test?
